main event: A series of flashes and explosions were observed and heard over a six month period on St. Lawrence Island, Alaska, with evaluations suggesting gunfire from shore.
interesting points: The sightings occurred from April to August 1951., Explosions were clearly heard by military personnel and natives in the area., Reports indicated ground vibrations accompanying the explosions., The source of the blasts was evaluated as potential gunfire or possibly related to local balloon or aircraft activity., Multiple reports from different military personnel confirmed the presence of the explosions.
witness description: members of the military and local natives
